headline.main: CARRIER PIGEONS IN HOTEL SERVICE; It Takes Less Than Three Hours to Get Answer from Philadelphia.

docs.abstract: carrier pigeon service with Bellevue-Stratford, Philadelphia, established
docs.lead_paragraph: Experiments with carrier pigeons have proved so successful, it was announced yesterday at the Waldorf, that a service has been established between that hotel and the Bellevue-Stratford, in Philadelphia. Assistant Manager Stewart said that he and Manager Frazer of the Bellevue-Stratford had been experimenting with pigeons raised on George C. Boldt's place, in the Thousand Islands, and that on Tuesday a demonstration had been made that showed their plan was entirely feasible.

headline.main: SCHOOL TO TEACH HOTEL MANAGEMENT; Fund Subscribed in Germany to Put the Business Among the Professions.

byline.original: By Marconi Transatlantic Wireless Telegraph to The New York Times

docs.abstract: Fund started in Berlin to train hotel-keepers as a profession; degree of Dr of Hotel-keeping (DH) to be awarded; details of plan
docs.lead_paragraph: BERLIN, Dec. 10. -- "D.H." (Doctor of Hotelkeeping) is a degree with which the world will become familiar if plans formulated in Berlin to-day are successfully carried out.
docs.snippet: BERLIN, Dec. 10. -- "D.H." (Doctor of Hotelkeeping) is a degree with which the world will become familiar if plans formulated in Berlin to-day are successfully carried out....

headline.main: HIS FORTUNE GONE, GOT JOB AS BELLBOY; Cambridge University Man Lost Inheritance in Wall Street and Had to Have Work.

docs.abstract: S D Harrower tells of losing fortune working as bellboy; describes bad conditions; blames hotel mgrs
docs.lead_paragraph: A career just the reverse of that of the lucky millionaire miner who recently returned to the Walcort, where he was formerly a bellboy, has been the experience of S.D. Harrower, son of a well- known shipping broker of Kensington, England, and one time student at Cambridge University. Until recently Harrower was the possessor of a considerable fortune.

headline.main: LONDON'S HOTEL CRISIS.; Shares at Heavy Discount -- Excessive Competition the Cause.

byline.original: Special Cable to THE NEW YORK TIMES

docs.abstract: Hotels in London reptdly face severe financial crisis; excessive competition seen as cause
docs.lead_paragraph: LONDON, Aug. 30. -- London's hotel keeping crisis, to which attention was called in yesterday's dispatches in THE NEW YORK SUNDAY TIMES, is arousing much comment. Hotel securities stand at a heavy discount in the market.

headline.main: BARGES FOR CANAL SUPPLIES.; Philadelphia Company Offers to Take Them to Panama.

docs.lead_paragraph: PHILADELPHIA, May 21. -- In view of the possible difficulty of the National Government in obtaining vessels to carry supplies and machinery to Panama to be used in the building of the canal there, barge owners of this city will make an effort to get the business. One barge company has already sent proposals to the Secretary of War offering to carry the Government's freight to Colon.
